data.title: Really want this place to be better
data.text:
i've probably eaten here 20+ times. i know i've filled a discount card with them at least 3 times (5 visits per card.) i work on the east side of Springdale and the Steam is a nice place to sit and relax. 

here's the main issue from someone who worked in restaurants for 10 years and visits cities specifically to eat in the restaurants. 

The Steam doesn't know what it wants to be. Is it a hipster dive bar, an upscale gastro pub, a salad/soup/sandwich, or a higher end restaurant (relative to it's competition in Springdale), a coffee shop even? 

Don't bother ordering coffee here. Unless the owner happens to be in there, none of the service staff know how to properly work the coffee equipment. I stopped in for a coffee once on my way back from lunch and the girl handed me something cold that i think was coffee. even though i didn't order a cold drink. 

So what's good here? The food for the most part is excellent. Lunches are there sweet spot. Although I have had the smoked turkey / avocado sandwich that was missing the avocado. the build your own brunch bowl is good. we've only gone for dinner once and brunch twice. but, lots of lunches. 

Now we get to the rub. The Service. at best the service is about equivalent to Neals. From the "welcome to X you can sit wherever you want" to the general air of unfriendliness. maybe it's a downtown Springdale thing but the exact same level of service can be had around the corner at Spring Street. the waitstaff is under-trained, and just lacking in any type of customer service attitude. go to a similarly priced brunch at Bordinos or Emilias and the service gap is hugely apparent. 

i don't want to get into specific details but last brunch my wife and took here was declared to be our last. we sat outside unattended for close to 20 minutes with empty mimosa glasses. then the staff cleared our glasses and didn't bother to ask if we wanted a new one. 10 minutes later we had to ask if our food was coming soon (eggs are still eggs right?). the only explanation we got was "really busy." but honestly, there were like 5 tables in the place. i'd hate to see what would happen if this place was truly busy. and a busy restaurant can cause breakdowns in the kitchen but shouldn't effect front of house service or customer courtesy. we finally got our food a few minutes later and it was very fresh and good, they did leave the mushrooms off my brunch bowl but at that point i was just ready to eat and go. 

in summary, i hate to say this, but just get your brunch and dinner elsewhere. still a good spot for lunch. but if you walk in and there are 3 or 4 tables without food you might as well plan on being there a full hour. 

i gave it a 3 star but i feel that's a bit generous.

data.title: Great Newer place
data.text: We had never been here and had passed by here seeing it was a newer place, we had family in from out of town, so decided to give the place a try.  Had brunch and between everyone ordering, a big variety of items were ordered.  The staff was very nice, we were seated out back on the patio since there aren't very many tables inside, but the weather was nice, so this was a plus.  The food was fresh and everyones order was correct, and brought out in what I thought was a decent time.  Can see that they are in the process of adding more space so this place seems to be up and coming, will return as the food was great.

data.title: Nice food pleasant atmosphere
data.text:
We frequented The Steam for a family meal.
The food was really nice I'd recommend the Jac burger.
Only down points were there is only one bathroom and as we were a family of 10 there wasn't enough menu's so we had to share.
Server's were attentive and friendly.

data.title: Avoid if you can
data.text:
Eating outside would be doable except for the bar next door having a large smoke area. We were forced to go inside due to the smell. Also a large mosquito farm on the patio so beware of that. 

The food was mediocre at best. Its something you could whip up at home for half the cost. I was told the fruit cup that accompanied my sandwich would have strawberries and pineapple in addition to oranges and apple slices. All that ended up in the cup were the orange and apple slices. 2 apple slices and 3 thin orange slices.

Will not be returning to dine.

data.title: Not bad...
data.text: We tried this quant little place just today while meeting friends for brunch.  It's a mom-and-pop type eatery in the heart of downtown.  It's in one of the older buildings, but has been nicely decorated with a blend of old and new; predominately a train motif... hence "The Steam."  There are only six tables, so it's not large at all; pretty much just a cozy little hole in the wall, which is actually a nice change from the chain restaurants.  The fare is mostly build-your-own variety; brunch bowls, pasta bowls, etc., and the food was pretty good.  They also serve alcohol, so it had a bar-like atmosphere. The only thing I disliked was the tab: $55.00 for a family of four, and with two of us drinking waters.  Ouch!  Still, the staff was quite friendly and very accommodating.  We will try it again, but next time we will probably stick to the daily specials.

data.title: Great addition to downtown Springdale
data.text: We have been to The Steam five or six times now and have enjoyed it each time.  Every meal has been above average to excellent.  The service has been friendly and the atmosphere is pleasant and modern.  They have a nice outdoor seating area that is very pleasant.  The location is right across from the new Farmer's Market area and bike trail.  The brunch bowls are excellent as was the pasta bowl I had.  Also, great sandwiches and salads.  Really, everything we have had has been very good.  We keep telling everyone about it!

data.title: Brunch
data.text: The food is very good but 55 minutes, forgotten coffee twice just isn't acceptable. Mentioned the excessive wait time twice and walked to the counter for my coffee after it was forgotten. No discount offered.

data.title: Go elsewhere
data.text: Sorely average food. Long wait times. Unfriendly staff. I was underwhelmed. The interior is clean and that's about the best part of this place.

data.title: A new restaurant with a lot of potential.
data.text:
From the other reviews and from the description (Steakhouse, seafood), I was expecting something other than I got.  Steam is more of a bar and grill.  The restaurant is small, but nicely decorated.  It is almost entirely booth seating, but the booths are very comfortable.  There is very nice soft jazz playing in the background.  The waitress was very nice, and went out of her way to make our meal pleasant.

The menu had a lot of salads and sandwiches, very little steak and seafood.  Our visit started off a little rocky.  My husband and I are not wine connoiseurs by any  means, but we like what we like.  We first asked for a blush, but they didn't have that.  We then asked for a nice Rose, but they didn't have that either.  The waitress did list off several beers, although they didn't seem to have a  wheat beer.  After several attempts to find something that we liked, we did settle on a nice Blue Moon.  I ordered the Steam house salad and my husband got the steak tips.  I was very happy with the salad, it was very large ( I only ordered a half order) and had most of the ingredients you would find in a Cobb salad.  My husband's steak tips came out in a nice sauce that reminded us of a homemade A1 sauce.  The side was sauteed mixed squash with three new potatoes.  All was very good, although the steak tips needed either some bread or noodles to balance it out.  We did ask for some bread, and the waitress brought out a very nice grilled crustini.  Both the online description of the restaurant and the signs in the shop said to be sure and ask about their desserts, so we did.  That day though, all they had were pre-wrapped cookies, which was a bit of a disappointment.

The decor, location, background music and waitress earned the 4 star rating that I have given.  While the food was good, it was not fantastic.  I see a lot of potential in this restaurant and will go back to see how they have improved.

data.title: Great Place to Eat!
data.text: Stopped in for a late lunch and everything was great. The atmosphere, the service and the food was made to order. I can be a bit picky when it comes to what and how my food is cooked and also what goes on my plate and what needs to be on the side. They went out of their way to make us feel at home. The Steam is a Great Place to Eat or just have Coffee. They make your meal a time to Relax,Enjoy and have Fun. We will be back every trip.

owner_response.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to tell others about your experience here.  We really appreciate you and hope you come see us again soon!

data.title: Good Addition to Downtown
data.text: This is a small restaurant in the downtown area of Springdale which is currently trying to reinvent their downtown and it's another excellent start!  The food is very good and tastes fresh and homemade.  Haven't tried their dinner menu yet, but the sandwiches/soup selection at lunch is excellent.  Will try this one again!

owner_response.author: Melanie V, Owner at The Steam, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. Our food is very fresh and almost everything is prepared from scratch and to order as much as possible. Everything we make is done with love and hopefully you can taste it in our food.  Please come see us again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not Edible
data.text: Went for dinner. My wife ordered the steak medium well. It came so overdone it was shoe leather. Two of us ordered the beef tips with portobello mushrooms. It too was cooked to dry tough meat in a sauce salty enough to be jerky. A glass of merlot was ordered. It was worse than stale box wine. In essence the meal was terrible. The waitress was nice though overly busy. You could pick just about any other restaurant  for better food.

owner_response.author: Melanie V, Owner at The Steam, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I apologize for your experience. We always strive to make sure everyone is satisfied before they leave our restaurant. I remember your meal as I was in the kitchen when you visited.  I was training a new grill and sauté cook that night and a few of the dishes were not to our regular high standards.  As with any learning experience, we need to know when something is not right so we can make sure it is. We would have gladly made you a new meal (with me at the helm instead) and/or a discount or dessert. I would have loved the opportunity to speak to you personally about your experience but you did not ask to see management or the chef. You left, unfortunately unhappy without a resolution. I hope that you are able to see that we have over a 90% satisfaction rate and that experiences like yours are very rare here at The Steam.  We invite you to give us a try again in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
